mods.note: John T. McMurran (1801-1866), a lawyer and state senator in Natchez, Mississippi, was married to the former Mary Louise Turner (1814-1891), and they built Melrose near Natchez, Mississippi in 1845. Together they had two children, John T. McMurran, Jr., and Mary Elizabeth McMurran (1835-1861)" John Jr. married Alie Austen (d.1899) of Baltimore County, Maryland, in 1856, and they resided at Riverside Plantation in Wilkinson County, Miss., until the Civil War. Mary Louise McMurran's sister was married to John Quitman. John, Jr. initially joined the Confederacy but an artillery accident caused him to lose his hearing. He subsequently moved to the District of Columbia and was a clerk in the U.S. government during the war.
